habitat_description:
The distribution of the southern painted turtle includes Louisiana, eastern Texas, Arkansas, southeastern Oklahoma, southeastern Missouri, western Kentucky, western Tennessee, southern Illinois, Alabama, and Mississippi (Natureserve.org; Starkey et al. 2003). This species is described as benthic, with burrowing taking place in or using soil, leaf litter, and fallen logs.

In general, this species inhabits big and medium sized rivers, low gradient streams, and shallow water springs and pools. Riparian habitats include forested wetland, scrub-shrub wetland, herbaceous wetland, and ephemeral pools (Natureserve.org). Typical sites include ponds, swamps, slow flowing water ways, marshes, meadows characterized by plenty of available basking sites, soft bottoms, and vast vegetative cover (Dundee and Rossman 1989).
